pr_title: Server changes for custom user management

timeline.message: Adjustments to ProvisionerService to support custom auth provider CRUD operations
Merge branch 'cloud-4.0' of github.com:Graylog2/graylog2-server into cloud-4.0

Fix order of tabs in dashboard after install (#9812)

## Motivation
Prior to this change, a dashboard installed by a content pack had a
tabs in a random order. Since we cannot change the order of the tabs
this is quite inconvinient for the user.

## Description
This change will do mutiple steps to fix that:
- Use a LinkedHashMap to ensure the order stays fix during content pack
  creation.
- Instead of using the serach QueryIds we use the views QueryIds which
  we previously fixed in the order.
- When loading a view and selecting the activeQuery we also use the
  view.state queryids instead of the search ones.

Fixes #8264

Show timezone setting to the user (#9814)

* Display the timezone settings to the user

## Motivation
Prior to this change, the user was not able to change his own timezone
settings since they were hidden to him.

## Description
This change will show the settings to the user so he can edit them.

* Fix settings section test

timeline.bodyText:
I've been wondering about naming this..
We currently have different flags for user accounts:

isReadOnly for internal system users that shouldn't be deleted or modified
isExternal  for users that shouldn't be managed from within graylog  (except for our cloud okta use case)

Would it make sense to add a third flag (e.g. isManaged) or should we simply mark okta users as not external?
It's probably not a big deal, just a thought..
timeline.author: mpfz0r

replies.bodyText: OTOH, from the cloud perspective, Okta is still kind of "internal", so maybe we should just leave it like it is :)
replies.author: mpfz0r

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the feedback @mpfz0r. Here's some of the thinking behind adding this property here, incase that helps the discussion:
The current definition for external users (as I understand) is that they exist in another system of record and are not permitted to be edited in Graylog. Okta users do not fall into this category, since they can be edited in Graylog. The intention of adding the isExternal flag to UserDetails is to allow the ProvisionerService to provision users with this flag set to false (the Okta case). The UserDetails object is just a means of sending user data into the ProvisionerService.
I did not yet have any plan to add any properties to the UserImpl persisted DB object, but happy to look at that further if you think we should identify the Okta users somehow.
replies.author: danotorrey
